page.title: 02Farming Around Martinstown.
page.content: The agricultural land of the area lies in the South Winterborne valley and on the surrounding chalk slopes. There are six main farms:Park,Ashton ,Winterborne Monkton,Wylye Croft and Clandon.Although just outside the grid, some of Manor Farm's fields occupy the Northernmost section. Most farming is dairy. The land cover survey shows a high percentage of rough or managed grassland.Many fields were also laid down with kale or similar fodder crops. There is little woodland here, although Ashton Farm has planted some acres along the Monkton road with coniferous seedlings since 1983.One difficulty for farmers is the large numbers of tumuli that litter this landscape.Conservation and economics battle over the question:To plough, graze or preserve?
